io.github.goodees.ese.core

Interface Event

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ImmutableEvent
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    EventHeader

    public interface Event
    Immutable fact about business domain relevant fact that became true.

    Every Event sourced entity class defines its own set of events.

    The serialization and deserialization format is not prescribed, but events may define annotations to support specific serialization kinds, e. g. Jackson annotations. The actual serialization and deserialization process is tasks of actual EventStore and EventLog implementations used by the runtime

    The methods provided in this interface define metadata that will be stored outside the journaled payload to enable querying and deserialization.

    Support for events based on Immutables is in package io.github.goodees.ese.immutables.

    • Method Detail

      • getType

        default String getType()
        The type of event. For every entity class this must uniquely identify the event to be created. If in future an event is removed, the store must be able to translate it to an equivalent event in new model.
        Returns:
        textual description of the type of event, uses class name by default, stripped from suffix Event, or prefix Immutable

      • entityId

        String entityId()
        The id of the entity this event relates to. All entities of a single class must have unique id.
        Returns:
        the entity id
        See Also:
        EventSourcedEntity.getIdentity()

      • getTimestamp

        java.time.Instant getTimestamp()
        The time when an event occurred.
        Returns:
        the instant of event creation

      • entityStateVersion

        long entityStateVersion()
        The version of the entity expected after this event is applied. This allows for performing optimistic locking on an entity.
        Returns:
        the version on an entity
        See Also:
        EventSourcedEntity.nextEventVersion()
